dialogues.line: O, go to. Well, well, Of all the faults beneath the heavens, the gods Do like this worst.

dialogues.speaker: Dionyza
dialogues.line: Be one of those that thinks The petty wrens of Tarsus will fly hence, And open this to Pericles. I do shame To think of what a noble strain you are, And of how coward a spirit.

dialogues.speaker: Cleon
dialogues.line: To such proceeding Whoever but his approbation added, Though not his prime consent, he did not flow From honourable courses.

dialogues.speaker: Dionyza
dialogues.line: Be it so, then: Yet none does know, but you, how she came dead, Nor none can know, Leonine being gone. She did distain my child, and stood between Her and her fortunes: none would look on her, But cast their gazes on Marina's face; Whilst ours was blurted at and held a malkin Not worth the time of day. It pierced me through; And though you call my course unnatural, You not your child well loving, yet I find It greets me as an enterprise of kindness Perform'd to your sole daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Cleon
dialogues.line: Heavens forgive it!

dialogues.speaker: Dionyza
dialogues.line: And as for Pericles, what should he say? We wept after her hearse, and yet we mourn. Her monument is almost finish'd, and her epitaphs In glittering golden characters express A general praise to her, and care in us At whose expense 'tis done.

dialogues.speaker: Cleon
dialogues.line: Thou art like the harpy, Which, to betray, dost, with thine angel's face, Seize with thine eagle's talons.

dialogues.speaker: Dionyza
dialogues.line: You are like one that superstitiously Doth swear to the gods that winter kills the flies: But yet I know you'll do as I advise.

dialogues.speaker: Gower
dialogues.line: Thus time we waste, and long leagues make short; Sail seas in cockles, have and wish but for't; Making, to take your imagination, From bourn to bourn, region to region. By you being pardon'd, we commit no crime To use one language in each several clime Where our scenes seem to live. I do beseech you To learn of me, who stand i'the gaps to teach you, The stages of our story. Pericles Is now again thwarting the wayward seas Attended on by many a lord and knight, To see his daughter, all his life's delight. Old Helicanus goes along. Behind Is left to govern, if you bear in mind, Old Escanes, whom Helicanus late Advanced in time to great and high estate. Well-sailing ships and bounteous winds have brought This king to Tarsus,-think his pilot thought; So with his steerage shall your thoughts go on,- To fetch his daughter home, who first is gone. Like motes and shadows see them move awhile; Your ears unto your eyes I'll reconcile. Dumb-show. Enter Pericles at one door with all his train; Cleon and Dionyza at the other. Cleon shows Pericles the tomb; whereat Pericles makes lamentation, puts on sackcloth and in a mighty passion departs. Then exeunt Cleon and Dionyza. See how belief may suffer by foul show; This borrow'd passion stands for true old woe; And Pericles, in sorrow all devour'd, With sighs shot through; and biggest tears o'ershower'd, Leaves Tarsus and again embarks. He swears Never to wash his face, nor cut his hairs: He puts on sackcloth, and to sea he bears A tempest, which his mortal vessel tears, And yet he rides it out. Now please you wit The epitaph is for Marina writ By wicked Dionyza. _The fairest, sweet'st, and best lies here, Who wither'd in her spring of year. She was of Tyrus the King's daughter, On whom foul death hath made this slaughter; Marina was she call'd; and at her birth, Thetis, being proud, swallow'd some part o' the earth: Therefore the earth, fearing to be o'erflow'd, Hath Thetis' birth-child on the heavens bestow'd: Wherefore she does, and swears she'll never stint, Make raging battery upon shores of flint._ No visor does become black villany So well as soft and tender flattery. Let Pericles believe his daughter's dead, And bear his courses to be ordered By Lady Fortune; while our scene must play His daughter's woe and heavy well-a-day In her unholy service. Patience, then, And think you now are all in Mytilene.

scenes.location: Mytilene. A street before the brothel.

dialogues.speaker: First Gentleman
dialogues.line: Did you ever hear the like?

dialogues.speaker: Second Gentleman
dialogues.line: No, nor never shall do in such a place as this, she being once gone.

dialogues.speaker: First Gentleman
dialogues.line: But to have divinity preached there! did you ever dream of such a thing?

dialogues.speaker: Second Gentleman
dialogues.line: No, no. Come, I am for no more bawdy houses: shall's go hear the vestals sing?

dialogues.speaker: First Gentleman
dialogues.line: I'll do anything now that is virtuous; but I am out of the road of rutting for ever.

scenes.location: The same. A room in the brothel.

dialogues.speaker: Pandar
dialogues.line: Well, I had rather than twice the worth of her she had ne'er come here.

dialogues.speaker: Bawd
dialogues.line: Fie, fie upon her! She's able to freeze the god Priapus, and undo a whole generation. We must either get her ravished, or be rid of her. When she should do for clients her fitment, and do me the kindness of our profession, she has me her quirks, her reasons, her master reasons, her prayers, her knees; that she would make a puritan of the devil, if he should cheapen a kiss of her.

dialogues.speaker: Boult
dialogues.line: Faith, I must ravish her, or she'll disfurnish us of all our cavaliers, and make our swearers priests.

dialogues.speaker: Pandar
dialogues.line: Now, the pox upon her green sickness for me!

dialogues.speaker: Bawd
dialogues.line: Faith, there's no way to be rid on't but by the way to the pox. Here comes the Lord Lysimachus disguised.

dialogues.speaker: Boult
dialogues.line: We should have both lord and lown, if the peevish baggage would but give way to customers.

dialogues.speaker: Lysimachus
dialogues.line: How now! How a dozen of virginities?

dialogues.speaker: Bawd
dialogues.line: Now, the gods to bless your honour!

dialogues.speaker: Boult
dialogues.line: I am glad to see your honour in good health.

dialogues.speaker: Lysimachus
dialogues.line: You may so; 'tis the better for you that your resorters stand upon sound legs. How now? Wholesome iniquity have you that a man may deal withal, and defy the surgeon?

dialogues.speaker: Bawd
dialogues.line: We have here one, sir, if she would-but there never came her like in Mytilene.

dialogues.speaker: Lysimachus
dialogues.line: If she'd do the deed of darkness, thou wouldst say.

dialogues.speaker: Bawd
dialogues.line: Your honour knows what 'tis to say well enough.

dialogues.speaker: Lysimachus
dialogues.line: Well, call forth, call forth.

dialogues.speaker: Boult
dialogues.line: For flesh and blood, sir, white and red, you shall see a rose; and she were a rose indeed, if she had but-

dialogues.speaker: Lysimachus
dialogues.line: What, prithee?

dialogues.speaker: Boult
dialogues.line: O, sir, I can be modest.

dialogues.speaker: Lysimachus
dialogues.line: That dignifies the renown of a bawd no less than it gives a good report to a number to be chaste.

dialogues.speaker: Bawd
dialogues.line: Here comes that which grows to the stalk; never plucked yet, I can assure you. Is she not a fair creature?

dialogues.speaker: Lysimachus
dialogues.line: Faith, she would serve after a long voyage at sea. Well, there's for you: leave us.

dialogues.speaker: Bawd
dialogues.line: I beseech your honour, give me leave: a word, and I'll have done presently.

dialogues.speaker: Lysimachus
dialogues.line: I beseech you, do.

dialogues.speaker: Bawd
dialogues.line: First, I would have you note, this is an honourable man.

dialogues.speaker: Marina
dialogues.line: I desire to find him so, that I may worthily note him.

dialogues.speaker: Bawd
dialogues.line: Next, he's the governor of this country, and a man whom I am bound to.

dialogues.speaker: Marina
dialogues.line: If he govern the country, you are bound to him indeed; but how honourable he is in that, I know not. BAWD. Pray you, without any more virginal fencing, will you use him kindly? He will line your apron with gold.

dialogues.speaker: Marina
dialogues.line: What he will do graciously, I will thankfully receive.

dialogues.speaker: Lysimachus
dialogues.line: Ha' you done?

dialogues.speaker: Bawd
dialogues.line: My lord, she's not paced yet: you must take some pains to work her to your manage. Come, we will leave his honour and her together. Go thy ways.

dialogues.speaker: Lysimachus
dialogues.line: Now, pretty one, how long have you been at this trade?

dialogues.speaker: Marina
dialogues.line: What trade, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Lysimachus
dialogues.line: Why, I cannot name't but I shall offend.

dialogues.speaker: Marina
dialogues.line: I cannot be offended with my trade. Please you to name it.

dialogues.speaker: Lysimachus
dialogues.line: How long have you been of this profession?

dialogues.speaker: Marina
dialogues.line: E'er since I can remember. LYSIMACHUS. Did you go to't so young? Were you a gamester at five or at seven?

dialogues.speaker: Marina
dialogues.line: Earlier, too, sir, if now I be one.

dialogues.speaker: Lysimachus
dialogues.line: Why, the house you dwell in proclaims you to be a creature of sale.

dialogues.speaker: Marina
dialogues.line: Do you know this house to be a place of such resort, and will come into't? I hear say you are of honourable parts, and are the governor of this place.

dialogues.speaker: Lysimachus
dialogues.line: Why, hath your principal made known unto you who I am?

dialogues.speaker: Marina
dialogues.line: Who is my principal?

dialogues.speaker: Lysimachus
dialogues.line: Why, your herb-woman; she that sets seeds and roots of shame and iniquity. O, you have heard something of my power, and so stand aloof for more serious wooing. But I protest to thee, pretty one, my authority shall not see thee, or else look friendly upon thee. Come, bring me to some private place: come, come.

dialogues.speaker: Marina
dialogues.line: If you were born to honour, show it now; If put upon you, make the judgement good That thought you worthy of it.

dialogues.speaker: Lysimachus
dialogues.line: How's this? how's this? Some more; be sage.

dialogues.speaker: Marina
dialogues.line: For me, That am a maid, though most ungentle Fortune Have placed me in this sty, where, since I came, Diseases have been sold dearer than physic, O, that the gods Would set me free from this unhallow'd place, Though they did change me to the meanest bird That flies i' the purer air!

dialogues.speaker: Lysimachus
dialogues.line: I did not think Thou couldst have spoke so well; ne'er dream'd thou couldst. Had I brought hither a corrupted mind, Thy speech had alter'd it. Hold, here's gold for thee: Persever in that clear way thou goest, And the gods strengthen thee!

dialogues.speaker: Marina
dialogues.line: The good gods preserve you!

dialogues.speaker: Lysimachus
dialogues.line: For me, be you thoughten That I came with no ill intent; for to me The very doors and windows savour vilely. Fare thee well. Thou art a piece of virtue, and I doubt not but thy training hath been noble. Hold, here's more gold for thee. A curse upon him, die he like a thief, That robs thee of thy goodness! If thou dost Hear from me, it shall be for thy good.

dialogues.speaker: Boult
dialogues.line: I beseech your honour, one piece for me.

dialogues.speaker: Lysimachus
dialogues.line: Avaunt, thou damned door-keeper! Your house but for this virgin that doth prop it, Would sink and overwhelm you. Away!

dialogues.speaker: Boult
dialogues.line: How's this? We must take another course with you. If your peevish chastity, which is not worth a breakfast in the cheapest country under the cope, shall undo a whole household, let me be gelded like a spaniel. Come your ways.

dialogues.speaker: Marina
dialogues.line: Whither would you have me?

dialogues.speaker: Boult
dialogues.line: I must have your maidenhead taken off, or the common hangman shall execute it. Come your ways. We'll have no more gentlemen driven away. Come your ways, I say.

dialogues.speaker: Bawd
dialogues.line: How now! what's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Boult
dialogues.line: Worse and worse, mistress; she has here spoken holy words to the Lord Lysimachus.

dialogues.speaker: Bawd
dialogues.line: O, abominable!

dialogues.speaker: Boult
dialogues.line: She makes our profession as it were to stink afore the face of the gods.

dialogues.speaker: Bawd
dialogues.line: Marry, hang her up for ever!

dialogues.speaker: Boult
dialogues.line: The nobleman would have dealt with her like a nobleman, and she sent him away as cold as a snowball; saying his prayers too.

dialogues.speaker: Bawd
dialogues.line: Boult, take her away; use her at thy pleasure: crack the glass of her virginity, and make the rest malleable.

dialogues.speaker: Boult
dialogues.line: An if she were a thornier piece of ground than she is, she shall be ploughed.

dialogues.speaker: Marina
dialogues.line: Hark, hark, you gods!

dialogues.speaker: Bawd
dialogues.line: She conjures: away with her! Would she had never come within my doors! Marry, hang you! She's born to undo us. Will you not go the way of womankind? Marry, come up, my dish of chastity with rosemary and bays!

dialogues.speaker: Boult
dialogues.line: Come, mistress; come your way with me.

dialogues.speaker: Marina
dialogues.line: Whither wilt thou have me?

dialogues.speaker: Boult
dialogues.line: To take from you the jewel you hold so dear.

dialogues.speaker: Marina
dialogues.line: Prithee, tell me one thing first.

dialogues.speaker: Boult
dialogues.line: Come now, your one thing?

dialogues.speaker: Marina
dialogues.line: What canst thou wish thine enemy to be?

dialogues.speaker: Boult
dialogues.line: Why, I could wish him to be my master, or rather, my mistress.

dialogues.speaker: Marina
dialogues.line: Neither of these are so bad as thou art, Since they do better thee in their command. Thou hold'st a place, for which the pained'st fiend Of hell would not in reputation change: Thou art the damned doorkeeper to every Coistrel that comes inquiring for his Tib. To the choleric fisting of every rogue Thy ear is liable, thy food is such As hath been belch'd on by infected lungs.

dialogues.speaker: Boult
dialogues.line: What would you have me do? Go to the wars, would you? where a man may serve seven years for the loss of a leg, and have not money enough in the end to buy him a wooden one?

dialogues.speaker: Marina
dialogues.line: Do anything but this thou doest. Empty Old receptacles, or common shores, of filth; Serve by indenture to the common hangman: Any of these ways are yet better than this; For what thou professest, a baboon, could he speak, Would own a name too dear. O, that the gods Would safely deliver me from this place! Here, here's gold for thee. If that thy master would gain by me, Proclaim that I can sing, weave, sew, and dance, With other virtues, which I'll keep from boast; And I will undertake all these to teach. I doubt not but this populous city will Yield many scholars.

dialogues.speaker: Boult
dialogues.line: But can you teach all this you speak of?

dialogues.speaker: Marina
dialogues.line: Prove that I cannot, take me home again, And prostitute me to the basest groom That doth frequent your house.

dialogues.speaker: Boult
dialogues.line: Well, I will see what I can do for thee: if I can place thee, I will.

dialogues.speaker: Marina
dialogues.line: But amongst honest women.

dialogues.speaker: Boult
dialogues.line: Faith, my acquaintance lies little amongst them. But since my master and mistress have bought you, there's no going but by their consent: therefore I will make them acquainted with your purpose, and I doubt not but I shall find them tractable enough. Come, I'll do for thee what I can; come your ways.

scenes.location: On board Pericles' ship, off Mytilene. A close pavilion on

dialogues.speaker: Tyrian Sailor
dialogues.line: Where is lord Helicanus? He can resolve you. O, here he is. Sir, there's a barge put off from Mytilene, And in it is Lysimachus the governor, Who craves to come aboard. What is your will?

dialogues.speaker: Helicanus
dialogues.line: That he have his. Call up some gentlemen.

dialogues.speaker: Tyrian Sailor
dialogues.line: Ho, gentlemen! my lord calls.

dialogues.speaker: First Gentleman
dialogues.line: Doth your lordship call?

dialogues.speaker: Helicanus
dialogues.line: Gentlemen, there is some of worth would come aboard; I pray ye, greet them fairly.  Enter, from thence, Lysimachus and Lords; with the Gentlemen and the two Sailors.

dialogues.speaker: Tyrian Sailor
dialogues.line: Sir, This is the man that can, in aught you would, Resolve you.

dialogues.speaker: Lysimachus
dialogues.line: Hail, reverend sir! the gods preserve you!

dialogues.speaker: Helicanus
dialogues.line: And you, sir, to outlive the age I am, And die as I would do.

dialogues.speaker: Lysimachus
dialogues.line: You wish me well. Being on shore, honouring of Neptune's triumphs, Seeing this goodly vessel ride before us, I made to it, to know of whence you are.

dialogues.speaker: Helicanus
dialogues.line: First, what is your place?

dialogues.speaker: Lysimachus
dialogues.line: I am the governor of this place you lie before.

dialogues.speaker: Helicanus
dialogues.line: Sir, our vessel is of Tyre, in it the king; A man who for this three months hath not spoken To anyone, nor taken sustenance But to prorogue his grief.

dialogues.speaker: Lysimachus
dialogues.line: Upon what ground is his distemperature?

dialogues.speaker: Helicanus
dialogues.line: 'Twould be too tedious to repeat; But the main grief springs from the loss Of a beloved daughter and a wife.

dialogues.speaker: Lysimachus
dialogues.line: May we not see him?

dialogues.speaker: Helicanus
dialogues.line: You may; But bootless is your sight: he will not speak To any.

dialogues.speaker: Lysimachus
dialogues.line: Yet let me obtain my wish.

dialogues.speaker: Helicanus
dialogues.line: Behold him. This was a goodly person. Till the disaster that, one mortal night, Drove him to this.

dialogues.speaker: Lysimachus
dialogues.line: Sir king, all hail! The gods preserve you! Hail, royal sir!

dialogues.speaker: Helicanus
dialogues.line: It is in vain; he will not speak to you.

dialogues.speaker: First Lord
dialogues.line: Sir, we have a maid in Mytilene, I durst wager, Would win some words of him.

dialogues.speaker: Lysimachus
dialogues.line: 'Tis well bethought. She questionless with her sweet harmony And other chosen attractions, would allure, And make a battery through his deafen'd parts, Which now are midway stopp'd: She is all happy as the fairest of all, And, with her fellow maids, is now upon The leafy shelter that abuts against The island's side.

dialogues.speaker: Helicanus
dialogues.line: Sure, all's effectless; yet nothing we'll omit That bears recovery's name. But, since your kindness We have stretch'd thus far, let us beseech you That for our gold we may provision have, Wherein we are not destitute for want, But weary for the staleness.

dialogues.speaker: Lysimachus
dialogues.line: O, sir, a courtesy Which if we should deny, the most just gods For every graff would send a caterpillar, And so inflict our province. Yet once more Let me entreat to know at large the cause Of your king's sorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Helicanus
dialogues.line: Sit, sir, I will recount it to you: But, see, I am prevented.

dialogues.speaker: Lysimachus
dialogues.line: O, here is the lady that I sent for. Welcome, fair one! Is't not a goodly presence?

dialogues.speaker: Helicanus
dialogues.line: She's a gallant lady.

dialogues.speaker: Lysimachus
dialogues.line: She's such a one, that, were I well assured Came of a gentle kind and noble stock, I'd wish no better choice, and think me rarely wed. Fair one, all goodness that consists in bounty Expect even here, where is a kingly patient: If that thy prosperous and artificial feat Can draw him but to answer thee in aught, Thy sacred physic shall receive such pay As thy desires can wish.

dialogues.speaker: Marina
dialogues.line: Sir, I will use My utmost skill in his recovery, provided That none but I and my companion maid Be suffer'd to come near him.

dialogues.speaker: Lysimachus
dialogues.line: Come, let us leave her, And the gods make her prosperous!

dialogues.speaker: Lysimachus
dialogues.line: Mark'd he your music?

dialogues.speaker: Marina
dialogues.line: No, nor look'd on us.

dialogues.speaker: Lysimachus
dialogues.line: See, she will speak to him.

dialogues.speaker: Marina
dialogues.line: Hail, sir! My lord, lend ear.

dialogues.speaker: Pericles
dialogues.line: Hum, ha!

dialogues.speaker: Marina
dialogues.line: I am a maid, My lord, that ne'er before invited eyes, But have been gazed on like a comet: she speaks, My lord, that, may be, hath endured a grief Might equal yours, if both were justly weigh'd. Though wayward Fortune did malign my state, My derivation was from ancestors Who stood equivalent with mighty kings: But time hath rooted out my parentage, And to the world and awkward casualties Bound me in servitude.  I will desist; But there is something glows upon my cheek, And whispers in mine ear â€˜Go not till he speak.'

dialogues.speaker: Pericles
dialogues.line: My fortunes-parentage-good parentage- To equal mine!-was it not thus? what say you?

dialogues.speaker: Marina
dialogues.line: I said, my lord, if you did know my parentage, You would not do me violence.

dialogues.speaker: Pericles
dialogues.line: I do think so. Pray you, turn your eyes upon me. You are like something that-what country-woman? Here of these shores?

dialogues.speaker: Marina
dialogues.line: No, nor of any shores: Yet I was mortally brought forth, and am No other than I appear.

dialogues.speaker: Pericles
dialogues.line: I am great with woe, and shall deliver weeping. My dearest wife was like this maid, and such a one My daughter might have been: my queen's square brows; Her stature to an inch; as wand-like straight; As silver-voiced; her eyes as jewel-like And cased as richly; in pace another Juno; Who starves the ears she feeds, and makes them hungry, The more she gives them speech. Where do you live?

dialogues.speaker: Marina
dialogues.line: Where I am but a stranger: from the deck You may discern the place.

dialogues.speaker: Pericles
dialogues.line: Where were you bred? And how achieved you these endowments, which You make more rich to owe?

dialogues.speaker: Marina
dialogues.line: If I should tell my history, it would seem Like lies disdain'd in the reporting.

dialogues.speaker: Pericles
dialogues.line: Prithee, speak: Falseness cannot come from thee; for thou look'st Modest as Justice, and thou seem'st a palace For the crown'd Truth to dwell in: I will believe thee, And make my senses credit thy relation To points that seem impossible; for thou look'st Like one I loved indeed. What were thy friends? Didst thou not say, when I did push thee back- Which was when I perceived thee-that thou cam'st From good descending?

dialogues.speaker: Marina
dialogues.line: So indeed I did.

dialogues.speaker: Pericles
dialogues.line: Report thy parentage. I think thou said'st Thou hadst been toss'd from wrong to injury, And that thou thought'st thy griefs might equal mine, If both were open'd.

dialogues.speaker: Marina
dialogues.line: Some such thing, I said, and said no more but what my thoughts Did warrant me was likely.

dialogues.speaker: Pericles
dialogues.line: Tell thy story; If thine consider'd prove the thousand part Of my endurance, thou art a man, and I Have suffer'd like a girl: yet thou dost look Like Patience gazing on kings' graves, and smiling Extremity out of act. What were thy friends? How lost thou them? Thy name, my most kind virgin? Recount, I do beseech thee: come, sit by me.

dialogues.speaker: Marina
dialogues.line: My name is Marina.

dialogues.speaker: Pericles
dialogues.line: O, I am mock'd, And thou by some incensed god sent hither To make the world to laugh at me.

dialogues.speaker: Marina
dialogues.line: Patience, good sir, Or here I'll cease.

dialogues.speaker: Pericles
dialogues.line: Nay, I'll be patient. Thou little know'st how thou dost startle me, To call thyself Marina.

dialogues.speaker: Marina
dialogues.line: The name Was given me by one that had some power, My father, and a king.

dialogues.speaker: Pericles
dialogues.line: How! a king's daughter? And call'd Marina?

dialogues.speaker: Marina
dialogues.line: You said you would believe me; But, not to be a troubler of your peace, I will end here.

dialogues.speaker: Pericles
dialogues.line: But are you flesh and blood? Have you a working pulse? and are no fairy? Motion! Well; speak on. Where were you born? And wherefore call'd Marina?

dialogues.speaker: Marina
dialogues.line: Call'd Marina For I was born at sea.

dialogues.speaker: Pericles
dialogues.line: At sea! What mother?

dialogues.speaker: Marina
dialogues.line: My mother was the daughter of a king; Who died the minute I was born, As my good nurse Lychorida hath oft Deliver'd weeping.

dialogues.speaker: Pericles
dialogues.line: O, stop there a little!  This is the rarest dream that e'er dull sleep Did mock sad fools withal: this cannot be: My daughter, buried. Well, where were you bred? I'll hear you more, to the bottom of your story, And never interrupt you.

dialogues.speaker: Marina
dialogues.line: You scorn: believe me, 'twere best I did give o'er.

dialogues.speaker: Pericles
dialogues.line: I will believe you by the syllable Of what you shall deliver. Yet, give me leave: How came you in these parts? Where were you bred?

dialogues.speaker: Marina
dialogues.line: The king my father did in Tarsus leave me; Till cruel Cleon, with his wicked wife, Did seek to murder me: and having woo'd A villain to attempt it, who having drawn to do't, A crew of pirates came and rescued me; Brought me to Mytilene. But, good sir. Whither will you have me? Why do you weep? It may be, You think me an impostor: no, good faith; I am the daughter to King Pericles, If good King Pericles be.

dialogues.speaker: Pericles
dialogues.line: Ho, Helicanus!

dialogues.speaker: Helicanus
dialogues.line: Calls my lord?

dialogues.speaker: Pericles
dialogues.line: Thou art a grave and noble counsellor, Most wise in general: tell me, if thou canst, What this maid is, or what is like to be, That thus hath made me weep.

dialogues.speaker: Helicanus
dialogues.line: I know not, But here is the regent, sir, of Mytilene Speaks nobly of her.

dialogues.speaker: Lysimachus
dialogues.line: She would never tell Her parentage; being demanded that, She would sit still and weep.

dialogues.speaker: Pericles
dialogues.line: O Helicanus, strike me, honour'd sir; Give me a gash, put me to present pain; Lest this great sea of joys rushing upon me O'erbear the shores of my mortality, And drown me with their sweetness.  O, come hither, Thou that beget'st him that did thee beget; Thou that wast born at sea, buried at Tarsus, And found at sea again! O Helicanus, Down on thy knees, thank the holy gods as loud As thunder threatens us: this is Marina. What was thy mother's name? tell me but that, For truth can never be confirm'd enough, Though doubts did ever sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Marina
dialogues.line: First, sir, I pray, what is your title?

dialogues.speaker: Pericles
dialogues.line: I am Pericles of Tyre: but tell me now My drown'd queen's name, as in the rest you said Thou hast been godlike perfect, The heir of kingdoms and another life To Pericles thy father.

dialogues.speaker: Marina
dialogues.line: Is it no more to be your daughter than To say my mother's name was Thaisa? Thaisa was my mother, who did end The minute I began.

dialogues.speaker: Pericles
dialogues.line: Now, blessing on thee! rise; thou art my child. Give me fresh garments. Mine own, Helicanus; She is not dead at Tarsus, as she should have been, By savage Cleon: she shall tell thee all; When thou shalt kneel, and justify in knowledge She is thy very princess. Who is this?

dialogues.speaker: Helicanus
dialogues.line: Sir, 'tis the governor of Mytilene, Who, hearing of your melancholy state, Did come to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Pericles
dialogues.line: I embrace you. Give me my robes. I am wild in my beholding. O heavens bless my girl! But, hark, what music? Tell Helicanus, my Marina, tell him O'er, point by point, for yet he seems to doubt, How sure you are my daughter. But, what music?

dialogues.speaker: Helicanus
dialogues.line: My lord, I hear none.

dialogues.speaker: Pericles
dialogues.line: None! The music of the spheres! List, my Marina.

dialogues.speaker: Lysimachus
dialogues.line: It is not good to cross him; give him way.

dialogues.speaker: Pericles
dialogues.line: Rarest sounds! Do ye not hear?

dialogues.speaker: Lysimachus
dialogues.line: Music, my lord? I hear.

dialogues.speaker: Pericles
dialogues.line: Most heavenly music! It nips me unto listening, and thick slumber Hangs upon mine eyes: let me rest.

dialogues.speaker: Lysimachus
dialogues.line: A pillow for his head: So, leave him all. Well, my companion friends, If this but answer to my just belief, I'll well remember you. Diana appears to Pericles as in a vision.

dialogues.speaker: Diana
dialogues.line: My temple stands in Ephesus: hie thee thither, And do upon mine altar sacrifice. There, when my maiden priests are met together, Before the people all, Reveal how thou at sea didst lose thy wife: To mourn thy crosses, with thy daughter's, call And give them repetition to the life. Or perform my bidding, or thou livest in woe: Do it, and happy; by my silver bow! Awake and tell thy dream.

dialogues.speaker: Pericles
dialogues.line: Celestial Dian, goddess argentine, I will obey thee. Helicanus!

dialogues.speaker: Helicanus
dialogues.line: Sir?

dialogues.speaker: Pericles
dialogues.line: My purpose was for Tarsus, there to strike The inhospitable Cleon; but I am For other service first: toward Ephesus Turn our blown sails; eftsoons I'll tell thee why.  Shall we refresh us, sir, upon your shore, And give you gold for such provision As our intents will need?

dialogues.speaker: Lysimachus
dialogues.line: Sir, with all my heart, And when you come ashore I have another suit.

dialogues.speaker: Pericles
dialogues.line: You shall prevail, were it to woo my daughter; For it seems you have been noble towards her.

dialogues.speaker: Lysimachus
dialogues.line: Sir, lend me your arm.

dialogues.speaker: Pericles
dialogues.line: Come, my Marina.

dialogues.speaker: Gower
dialogues.line: Now our sands are almost run; More a little, and then dumb. This, my last boon, give me, For such kindness must relieve me, That you aptly will suppose What pageantry, what feats, what shows, What minstrelsy, and pretty din, The regent made in Mytilene To greet the king. So he thrived, That he is promised to be wived To fair Marina; but in no wise Till he had done his sacrifice, As Dian bade: whereto being bound, The interim, pray you, all confound. In feather'd briefness sails are fill'd, And wishes fall out as they're will'd. At Ephesus, the temple see, Our king and all his company. That he can hither come so soon, Is by your fancy's thankful doom.

scenes.location: The temple of Diana at Ephesus; Thaisa standing near the

dialogues.speaker: Pericles
dialogues.line: Hail, Dian! to perform thy just command, I here confess myself the King of Tyre; Who, frighted from my country, did wed At Pentapolis the fair Thaisa. At sea in childbed died she, but brought forth A maid child call'd Marina; whom, O goddess, Wears yet thy silver livery. She at Tarsus Was nursed with Cleon; who at fourteen years He sought to murder: but her better stars Brought her to Mytilene; 'gainst whose shore Riding, her fortunes brought the maid aboard us, Where by her own most clear remembrance, she Made known herself my daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Thaisa
dialogues.line: Voice and favour! You are, you are-O royal Pericles!

dialogues.speaker: Pericles
dialogues.line: What means the nun? She dies! help, gentlemen!

dialogues.speaker: Cerimon
dialogues.line: Noble sir, If you have told Diana's altar true, This is your wife.

dialogues.speaker: Pericles
dialogues.line: Reverend appearer, no; I threw her overboard with these very arms.

dialogues.speaker: Cerimon
dialogues.line: Upon this coast, I warrant you.

dialogues.speaker: Pericles
dialogues.line: 'Tis most certain.

dialogues.speaker: Cerimon
dialogues.line: Look to the lady; O, she's but o'er-joy'd. Early in blustering morn this lady was Thrown upon this shore. I oped the coffin, Found there rich jewels; recover'd her, and placed her Here in Diana's temple.

dialogues.speaker: Pericles
dialogues.line: May we see them?

dialogues.speaker: Cerimon
dialogues.line: Great sir, they shall be brought you to my house, Whither I invite you. Look, Thaisa is Recovered.

dialogues.speaker: Thaisa
dialogues.line: O, let me look! If he be none of mine, my sanctity Will to my sense bend no licentious ear, But curb it, spite of seeing. O, my lord, Are you not Pericles? Like him you spake, Like him you are: did you not name a tempest, A birth, and death?

dialogues.speaker: Pericles
dialogues.line: The voice of dead Thaisa!

dialogues.speaker: Thaisa
dialogues.line: That Thaisa am I, supposed dead And drown'd.

dialogues.speaker: Pericles
dialogues.line: Immortal Dian!

dialogues.speaker: Thaisa
dialogues.line: Now I know you better, When we with tears parted Pentapolis, The king my father gave you such a ring.

dialogues.speaker: Pericles
dialogues.line: This, this: no more, you gods! your present kindness Makes my past miseries sports: you shall do well, That on the touching of her lips I may Melt and no more be seen. O, come, be buried A second time within these arms.

dialogues.speaker: Marina
dialogues.line: My heart Leaps to be gone into my mother's bosom.

dialogues.speaker: Pericles
dialogues.line: Look, who kneels here! Flesh of thy flesh, Thaisa; Thy burden at the sea, and call'd Marina For she was yielded there.

dialogues.speaker: Thaisa
dialogues.line: Blest, and mine own!

dialogues.speaker: Helicanus
dialogues.line: Hail, madam, and my queen!

dialogues.speaker: Thaisa
dialogues.line: I know you not.

dialogues.speaker: Pericles
dialogues.line: You have heard me say, when I did fly from Tyre, I left behind an ancient substitute: Can you remember what I call'd the man? I have named him oft.

dialogues.speaker: Thaisa
dialogues.line: 'Twas Helicanus then.

dialogues.speaker: Pericles
dialogues.line: Still confirmation: Embrace him, dear Thaisa; this is he. Now do I long to hear how you were found: How possibly preserved; and who to thank, Besides the gods, for this great miracle.

dialogues.speaker: Thaisa
dialogues.line: Lord Cerimon, my lord; this man, Through whom the gods have shown their power; that can From first to last resolve you.

dialogues.speaker: Pericles
dialogues.line: Reverend sir, The gods can have no mortal officer More like a god than you. Will you deliver How this dead queen relives?

dialogues.speaker: Cerimon
dialogues.line: I will, my lord. Beseech you, first go with me to my house, Where shall be shown you all was found with her; How she came placed here in the temple; No needful thing omitted.

dialogues.speaker: Pericles
dialogues.line: Pure Dian, bless thee for thy vision! I Will offer night-oblations to thee. Thaisa, This prince, the fair betrothed of your daughter, Shall marry her at Pentapolis. And now this ornament Makes me look dismal will I clip to form; And what this fourteen years no razor touch'd To grace thy marriage-day, I'll beautify.

dialogues.speaker: Thaisa
dialogues.line: Lord Cerimon hath letters of good credit, sir, My father's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Pericles
dialogues.line: Heavens make a star of him! Yet there, my queen, We'll celebrate their nuptials, and ourselves Will in that kingdom spend our following days: Our son and daughter shall in Tyrus reign. Lord Cerimon, we do our longing stay To hear the rest untold. Sir, lead's the way.

dialogues.speaker: Gower
dialogues.line: In Antiochus and his daughter you have heard Of monstrous lust the due and just reward: In Pericles, his queen and daughter seen, Although assail'd with Fortune fierce and keen, Virtue preserved from fell destruction's blast, Led on by heaven, and crown'd with joy at last. In Helicanus may you well descry A figure of truth, of faith, of loyalty: In reverend Cerimon there well appears The worth that learned charity aye wears: For wicked Cleon and his wife, when fame Had spread their cursed deed, the honour'd name Of Pericles, to rage the city turn, That him and his they in his palace burn. The gods for murder seemed so content To punish, although not done, but meant. So on your patience evermore attending, New joy wait on you! Here our play has ending.
